intro: Navicularia syriaca subsp. euxina, commonly known as the Syrian watercress, is a flowering plant species native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, green, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round, dark brown seeds. This subspecies is often found in moist, calcareous soils near water sources.
